intro: Rauwenhoffia siamensis, commonly known as the Siam orchid, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers, which bloom in shades of white and pink, are highly sought after for their ornamental value in horticulture.
